title: Scenario: After a user has performed a Stadium Checkin then that games information will appear under the Attended section of their profile
custom_preconds:
Given the user has performed a Stadium Checkin at the stadium where a game is being played
And the user has selected the My Profile section
custom_steps: When the users taps on Attended
custom_expected: Then the game checked into will be listed

title: Scenario: After a user has performed a Stadium Checkin then the Ballparks link in My Profile will increment its number by one to include that game in it's totals
custom_preconds:
Given the user has performed a Stadium Checkin at the stadium where a game is being played
And the user has selected the My Profile
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Ballparks button
custom_expected:
Then the Ballparks link will have its total incremented by one to compensate for the game that was just checked into
And the date should be updated

title: Scenario: After a user has performed a Stadium Checkin that they have never checked into before then the Teams link on the My Profile page will update by one to reflect that Team
custom_preconds:
Given the user has performed a Stadium Checkin at the stadium where a game is being played that they have never checked into before
And the user has selected the My Profile
custom_expected: Then the Teams link will have it's number incremented by one to include the new Team

title: Scenario: After a user has performed a Stadium Checkin at a Stadium where a game is being played then under the Teams link in My Profile that Team's badge will appear as unlocked
custom_preconds:
Given the user has performed a Stadium Checkin at the stadium were a game is being played
And the user has selected the More menu item
And the user has selected the My Profile menu item
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Ballpark section
custom_expected: Then a badge for that particular ballpark will appear as unlocked

title: Scenario: After a user has performed a Stadium Checkin then under the Teams link in My Profile only Stadiums that the user has completed a Stadium Checkin to will be lit up
custom_preconds:
Given the user has performed a Stadium Checkin at the stadium where a game is being played
And the user has selected the My Profile
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Teams link
custom_expected: Then the only badges lit up will be the ones where the user has previously performed a Stadium Checkin for

title: Scenario: Verify if we tap on the Teams link in My Profile that there is an Overall section with the users Home / Away record
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the More menu item
And we have selected the My Profile menu item
custom_steps: When we tap on the Teams link
custom_expected: Then we see an Overall section with the users Home / Away record

title: Scenario: Verify if we tap on the Teams link in My Profile that all teams for games that the user has performed a Stadium Checkin to are visible as well as the Home / Away record for each of those teams
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the More menu item
And we have selected the My Profile menu item
custom_steps: When we tap on the Teams link
custom_expected:
Then all Teams that the user has performed a Stadium Checkin to will be present
And all Teams that are present will have a Home / Away record associated to them

title: Scenario: My Profile - User Is Not Logged In
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been launched
And the user is not logged in
And has navigated to the At the Ballpark view
custom_steps: When the My Profile icon in the upper right of the screen has been tapped
custom_expected: Then the "Log in with your MLB.com account" form will appear on screen

title: Scenario: My Profile - User Is Logged In
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been launched and installed
And the user is logged in
And has navigated to the At the Ballpark view
custom_steps: When the My Profile icon in the upper right of the screen has been tapped
custom_expected: Then the My Profile page will open

title: Scenario: Register button
custom_preconds:
Given the user is not logged in
And has navigated to the log in page
custom_steps: When the Register button is tapped
custom_expected:
Then the registration page will open 
And be titled "Create a MLB.com Account"

title: Scenario: Register - Successfully Create an MLB.com Account
custom_preconds:
Given the user has navigated to the My Profile page
And is not logged in
And has tapped the Register button
custom_steps:
When all of the required fields(Email, Password, Confirm Password) are populated
And the Register button is tapped
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken back to the My Profile page

title: Scenario: Edit Button
custom_preconds:
Given the user has navigated to the My Profile Page
And is logged in
custom_steps: When the Edit button is tapped
custom_expected:
Then the My Profile edit page will open 
And there will be a Save button in the upper right corener
And there will editable First Name, Last Name, Nickname fields
And an avatar field

title: Scenario: Edit Menu - Change First Name
custom_preconds:

And is logged in
And the Edit button is tapped
custom_steps: When the First Name field is tapped
custom_expected:
Then the keyboard will appear on screen
And the field will become editable

Given the user has navigated to the My Profile Page

And the Edit button is tapped
custom_steps: When the Last Name field is tapped
custom_expected:
Then the keyboard will appear on screen
And the field will become editable

custom_preconds:
Given the user has navigated to the My Profile Page
And is logged in
And the Edit button is tapped
custom_steps: When the Nickname field is tapped
custom_expected:
Then the keyboard will appear on screen
And the field will become editable

custom_preconds:
Given the user has navigated to the My Profile Page
And is logged in
And the Edit button is tapped
custom_steps: When the add avatar field is tapped
custom_expected: Then the Avatars page will open

custom_steps: When reviewing the Attended button
custom_expected: Then the button will contain the number of attended games with the word "Attended" below

custom_steps: When examining the Ballparks button
custom_expected: Then the total number of Ballparks visited by the user & the word "Ballparks" will appear on the button

custom_preconds: Given the user is in the My Profile view
custom_steps: When the Ballparks button is tapped
custom_expected: Then Ballparks view is opened

title: Scenario: Ballparks View
custom_preconds: Given the user has tapped the Ballparks button
custom_steps: When examining the view
custom_expected:
Then the page will contain badges for all 31 ballparks
And the badges for the ballparks visited by the user will appear in full color
And the badges for the ballparks not yet visited by the user will appear as greyed out
But none of the badges will be tappable

custom_preconds: Given the user is in the Ballparks view
custom_steps: When the My Profile button is tapped
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken back to the My Profile view

custom_steps: When examining the Teams button
custom_expected: Then the total teams seen by the user and the word "Teams" will appear on the button

custom_steps: When the Teams button is tapped
custom_expected: Then the Teams view will open

custom_preconds: Given the user is in the Teams view
custom_steps: When the user taps the My Profile button
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken back to the My Profile view

title: Scenario: Favorite Teams
custom_preconds: Given the user is in My Profile
custom_steps: When the Favorite Teams cell is tapped
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the Teams view

title: Scenario: Setting Up Favorite Teams
custom_preconds: Given the user has Navigated to the Teams view
custom_steps: When the green plus sign next to a team name is tapped
custom_expected:
Then the team(s) selected will be moved up to the top of the screen below the Favorite Teams header
And tapping the My Profile button will take the user to the My Profile view

title: Scenario: Removing Favorite Teams
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in the Teams view
And has at least one favorite team set up
custom_steps:
When tapping the red remove symbol
And tapping the delete button that appears to the right of the team name
custom_expected: Then the team name will be removed from below the Favorite Teams header

title: Scenario: Reordering Favorite Teams
custom_preconds:
Given the user has navigated to the Teams view
And has selected multiple favorite teams
custom_steps:
When the user taps and holds the menu node to the right of the team name
And drags the team cell either up or down to a new position
custom_expected: Then the team name will remain in its new position

custom_preconds: Given the user is in the My Profile view
custom_steps: When the Unlocked Offers cell is tapped
custom_expected: Then the Unlocked Offers view will open

custom_expected: Then the Account view will open

title: Scenario: Change Email
custom_preconds: Given the user has an existing BAMNET account
custom_steps:
When the associated email address has been changed
And the user attempts to log in
custom_expected: Then an Invalid Email/Password message will appear below the Email and Password fields

title: Scenario: Change Password
custom_preconds: Given the user has an existing BAMNET account
custom_steps:
When the associated password has been changed
And the user attempts to log in
custom_expected: Then an Invalid Email/Password message will appear below the Email and Password fields

title: Scenario: Forgot Password Link
custom_preconds: Given the user is in the Account view
custom_steps: When the Forgot Password link is tapped
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the Password view

title: Scenario: Forgot Password Flow
custom_preconds:
Given the user has tapped the Forgot Password link
And has entered the associated email address
custom_steps: When the Send button is tapped
custom_expected: Then the user will receive an email with a temporary password

title: Scenario: Clear Account Information Button
custom_preconds: Given the user is in the Account view
custom_steps: When the Clear Account Information button is tapped
custom_expected: Then both the Email and Password fields will be blanked out

title: Scenario: Facebook Cell
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in the My Profile view
And the user does not have the Facebook app installed
custom_steps: When the Login button in the Facebook cell is tapped
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the Facebook login webview

title: Scenario: Facebook Login - Successful
custom_preconds: Given the user has initiated the Facebook login flow
custom_steps:
When valid credentials have been entered
And the Authorize App button has been tapped
custom_expected:
Then the user will be directed back to the My Profile view after tapping the Okay button in the upper right
And the Login button's label will change to Logout

title: Scenario: Facebook Login - Unsuccessful
custom_preconds: Given the user has initiated the Facebook login flow
custom_steps:
When invalid credentials have been entered
And the Authorize App button has been tapped
custom_expected: Then the user will be prompted by a message stating that the credentials were invalid

title: Scenario: Twitter Cell
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in the My Profile page
And a Twitter account is set up on the device
custom_steps: When the Connect button in the Twitter cell is tapped
custom_expected:
The user will be logged into Twitter
And the label on the button will change to Logout

title: Scenario: Twitter Login - Unsuccessful
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in the My Profile view
And has NOT configured a Twitter account on the device
custom_steps: When the Connect button is tapped
custom_expected:
Then the user will be prompted by a message stating: "Error...Error retrieving twitter accounts. Please add a twitter account in your phone settings"
And tapping the Okay button will clear the prompt

title: Scenario: Foursquare Cell
custom_preconds: Given the user is in the My Profile view
custom_steps: When the Connect button in the Foursquare cell is tapped
custom_expected: Then the Foursquare login page will be launched

title: Scenario: Foursquare Login - Successful
custom_preconds: Given the Connect button in the Foursquare cell has been tapped
custom_steps:
When the LOG IN button has been tapped 
And the user enters both a valid Foursquare Email/phone & password
And taps a subsequent Log In button
custom_expected:
Then the user will be taken back to the My Profile view
And Connect button's label will change to Logout

title: Scenario: Foursquare Login - Unsuccessful
custom_preconds: Given the Connect button in the Foursquare cell has been tapped
custom_steps:
When the LOG IN button has been tapped 
And the user enters both an invalid Foursquare Email/phone or password
And taps a subsequent Log In button
custom_expected: Then the user will be prompted by the following message: "The email/phone you entered is incorrect. Please try again"

title: Accessing the Nav Bar
custom_preconds:
Given the user is inside the app
And the user is not in a webview
custom_steps:
When the user swipes from the left edge of the screen to the right
Or when the user taps on the hamburger button at the top left
custom_expected: Then the Nav Bar will slide out from left to right

title: Scrolling the Nav Bar
custom_preconds: Given the user has the nav bar open
custom_steps: When the user scrolls their finger up or down on the nav bar
custom_expected: Then the nav bar will scroll as expected

title: Dismissing the Nav Bar
custom_preconds: Given the user has the nav bar open
custom_steps:
When the user swipes his finger on the nav bar from right to left
Or when the user taps any area to the right of the nav bar
Or when the user taps on the hamburger button on the top left
custom_expected: Then the nav bar will dismiss

title: If a user has multiple memberships
custom_preconds: Given the user has the nav bar open
custom_steps: When the user has multiple memberships
custom_expected:
Then all memberships will be displayed in the Accounts section
And the order is based on the following logic

- Primary membership (Season ticket program) takes priority.  
- If there is no Season ticket program, single ticket program will take priority.
- If there are multiple single ticket programs, make favorite team ticket program take priority.  
- If there are multiple single ticket programs, no fav team selected, make local team ticket program take priority .
- If there are multiple single ticket programs, no fav team selected, no location service detected, display programs in alphabetic order.

title: Add Your Programs
custom_preconds: Given the user has the nav bar open
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Add Your Programs button under Accounts
custom_expected:
Then the user will be brought to the Program Importing Status screen in an attempt to link their accounts
And if the user taps the skip button
Then the user will be brought to a page about adding programs manually

title: Season Ticket Program takes priority
custom_preconds: Given the user has previously added a Season Ticket Program account
custom_steps: When the user launches the app
custom_expected: Then the initial landing page will reflect the Season Ticket Program

title: When there is no Season Ticket Program, but there is a Single Ticket Program
custom_preconds:
Given the user has added one Single Ticket Program
And the user has no Season Ticket Program
custom_steps: When the user launches the app
custom_expected: Then the landing page will reflect the Single Ticket Program

title: When there are multiple Single Ticket Programs and a Favorite Team set
custom_preconds:
Given the user has added multiple Single Ticket Programs
And the user has no Season Ticket Program
And the user has set a Favorite Team
custom_steps: When the user launches the app
custom_expected: Then the landing page will reflect the user's Favorite Team's Single Ticket Program

title: When there are multiple Single ticket programs and No Favorite Team set
custom_preconds:
Given the user has added multiple Single Ticket Programs
And the user has no Season Ticket Program
And the user has Not set a Favorite Team
And the user has location services for the app set to On
custom_steps: When the user launches the app
custom_expected: Then the landing page will reflect the local team's Single Ticket Program

title: When there are multiple Single ticket programs with No Favorite Team set and Location Services turned Off
custom_preconds:
Given the user has added multiple Single Ticket Programs
And the user has no Season Ticket Program
And the user has Not set a Favorite Team
And the user has location services for the app set to Off
custom_steps: When the user launches the app
custom_expected: Then the landing page will reflect the first program the user is linked to alphabetically

title: Favorite team set
custom_preconds:
Given the user has not added any single or season ticket programs
And the user has set a Favorite Team
custom_steps: When the user launches the app
custom_expected: Then the landing page will reflect the Ballpark Guide page for the user's Favorite Team

title: No Favorite team set
custom_preconds:
Given the user has not added any single or season ticket programs
And the user has Not set a Favorite Team
And the user has location services for the app set to On
custom_steps: When the user launches the app
custom_expected: Then the side nav reflect the favorite team underneath the ballpark section

title: No Favorite Team set and Location Services turned Off
custom_preconds:
Given the user has not added any single or season ticket programs
And the user has Not set a Favorite Team
And the user has location services for the app set to Off
custom_steps: When the user launches the app
custom_expected: Then the Ballpark Picker page will be displayed

title: See All button
custom_preconds: Given the user has the nav bar open
custom_steps: When the user taps on the See All button next to Ballparks
custom_expected: Then the user will be brought to the Ballpark Picker page

title: Ballparks displayed in Nav Bar
custom_preconds:
Given the user has the nav bar open
And the user has location services on
custom_steps: When the user looks at the Ballparks section on the nav bar
custom_expected:
Then the user will see their Favorite Team's park (top 2 if applicable) listed first followed by nearby ballparks
And if no favorite team is selected the user will see nearby ballparks only

title: Ballparks displayed in Nav Bar and Location Services turned Off
custom_preconds:
Given the user has the nav bar open
And the user has location services Off
custom_steps: When the user looks at the Ballparks section on the nav bar
custom_expected:
Then the section will be blank if no favorite teams are set
And if the user has 1 (or 2) favorite teams set those will appear

custom_steps: When the user taps on the Home button next to Journal
custom_expected: Then the user will be brought to the Journal page

custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to their History page

custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the Photos page

custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the Offers page

custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the General Settings Page
